Articles.Content:
Hello,

I've re-installed the game after a year or so not playing and the game is always crashing on launch. It doesn't even reach the main menu and I get an "oops" error instead.

I've checked the RAM, it doesn't stop climbing (up to 1.5 gig) and the crash logs are showing errors allocating memory ... Is my system not good enough for the new versions of KSP ?

I'm on windows vista 32, ksp version is 0.90, system specs / crash logs :

DxDiag.txt

error.log

output_log.txt

Thanks.

Welcome to the forums!

You are running out of memory:

DynamicHeapAllocator out of memory - Could not get memory for large allocationCould not allocate memory: System out of memory!

The game requires quite a bit more than it did a year ago, which puts it over the 2 GB process limit for 32-bit Windows. Unless you can upgrade to a 64-bit operating system (and preferably install more RAM), your best option is to lower the texture quality:

  1. Open the settings.cfg in your KSP folder with Notepad.
  2. Find the TEXTURE_QUALITY setting.
  3. Change it to 1 or 2.
  4. Save and launch KSP.
